item.value: Opened in 2010, the Burj Khalifa in Dubai is the tallest building in the world.
The Surface Area of the earth is 197 million square miles, about two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first telephone in 1876.
The explosion of Mount Tambora, on Sumbawa island, Indonesia in 1815 was heard 2,600 km (1,600 mi) away and has been called the loudest sound ever heard by humans.
There are 195 countries in the world and there are more than 2,700 languages.
The world's oldest person was Kama Chinen. She lived in the Japanese island of Okinawa. She died a week before her 115th birthday. She was born on May 10, 1895.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is thirteen seconds
The Earth orbits the Sun at an average speed of 29.79 km/s ( 67,000 miles/hour).
The South Pole is the least sunny placeon earth with only 182 days a year off sunshine
Roughly 70 percent of an adult's body is made up of water.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
Sound travels at a speed of around 767 miles per hour (1,230 kilometres per hour).
New York is the city with the biggest population in America. It has over 8.3 million inhabitants.
The Amazon is the second longest river. It is 6.400 km ( 4,000 miles ) long. It flows into the Atlantic ocean.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. It measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The banana tree is not actually a tree, it is a herb. It bears fruit once a year and then dies.
China has more than 350 million telephones, the most of any other country. The United States is second with 268 million.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. Known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, the quake measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
The first 'talkie' movie was Al Jolson's The Jazz Singer released in 1927.
